questionData.explanation_of_Question: 這題考驗學生使用讓步連接詞 'although' 來表達對比關係。兩種語序都正確：1) Although + 從句, 主句；2) 主句 + although + 從句。重點是理解兩個句子之間的邏輯關係：儘管天氣很糟，但還是決定去健行，這是一種對比或讓步的關係。
questionData.instruction: 請使用 'although' 將這兩個句子合併成一個複合句。
questionData.sentence_b: We decided to go hiking anyway.
standard_answers: Although the weather was terrible, we decided to go hiking anyway.
We decided to go hiking anyway although the weather was terrible.

questionData.combining_method: 關係子句 (Relative Clause) 或 分詞構句 (Participial Phrase)
questionData.explanation_of_Question: 這題考驗學生使用關係子句 (非限定用法) 或分詞構句來合併句子並表達額外資訊或狀態。關係子句使用 'which' 引導，分詞構句則用 '-ing' 開頭。
questionData.instruction: 請使用關係子句或分詞構句將這兩個句子合併。
questionData.sentence_a: The ancient castle stood on the hill.
questionData.sentence_b: It was largely ignored by tourists.
standard_answers: The ancient castle, which stood on the hill, was largely ignored by tourists.
Standing on the hill, the ancient castle was largely ignored by tourists.

questionData.combining_method: 時間副詞子句 (Subordinating Conjunction) 或 完成式分詞構句 (Perfect Participial Phrase)
questionData.explanation_of_Question: 這題考驗學生使用時間副詞子句 ('After') 或完成式分詞構句 ('Having + past participle') 來合併句子，強調動作發生的先後順序。
questionData.instruction: 請使用表示時間的連接詞或完成式分詞構句將這兩個句子合併。
questionData.sentence_b: He submitted it to his manager.
standard_answers: After he finished reading the report, he submitted it to his manager.
Having finished reading the report, he submitted it to his manager.
He submitted the report to his manager after he finished reading it.

questionData.explanation_of_Question: 這題考驗學生使用條件連接詞 'if' 來合併句子，表達條件與結果的關係。條件子句可以使用逗號與主要子句隔開，也可以放在主要子句之後。
questionData.instruction: 請使用 'if' 將這兩個句子合併成一個複合句。
standard_answers: If you study hard, you will pass the exam.
You will pass the exam if you study hard.

questionData.explanation_of_Question: 這題考驗學生使用關係代名詞 'who' 來合併句子，提供關於前面提及的人 (Mr. Smith) 的額外資訊。在這裡使用非限定關係子句，需用逗號隔開。
questionData.instruction: 請使用 'who' 將這兩個句子合併。
questionData.sentence_b: He volunteers at the local animal shelter every weekend.
standard_answers: Mr. Smith, who volunteers at the local animal shelter every weekend, is my neighbor.
